history.content:
Linear algebra: math 54/110

Probability theory: ee126, stat134, stat140

I've personally taken 134 but from my understanding, stat 134 is a lot more focused on theory and continuous distributions while ee 126 applies probability theory a lot more to cs topics. If you are mostly interested in probability theory to better understand ml/nn, 126 is probably better 

Stat 140 should be a mix of both classes. If it's written with data science in mind, it should spend more time covering topics relevant to machine learning like bayesian inference. 

EDIT: Another good one is VS265 - Neural Computation. It's only offered every other year though and was just offered this past semester.

-------

To clarify: are you looking for classes that provide a mathematical background to help you understand ML? If so, then see above.

Or did you mean: courses that are specifically focused on the math behind ML, e.g. a course that specifically discusses neural networks? If so, I don't think there are any undergrad classes that do this.

children.subject: EE127 should probably be in the student's response as well.

history.content: Are there any good classes on the mathematical aspect of machine learning , neural networks ? I imagine something like EE126 / probability classes?
history.subject: Mathematical aspect of neural networks , machine learning
